snippet: An incentive to get customers to use renewable energy systems is now seen as overly generous in some circles, as it may raise rates for other customers.
abstract: Net metering benefit, which is available to residential and commercial customers with renewable energy systems in more than 40 states and has helped spur a boom in solar installations, is at the heart of a battle; solar industry is pressing to raise regulatory limits on the systems, while major utilities say expansion will shift the fixed costs of maintaining the electric grid to customers unable to afford increases; regulators are in the middle.
lead_paragraph: An incentive to get customers to use renewable energy systems is now seen as overly generous in some circles, as it may raise rates for other customers.

headline.seo: Solar Payments Set Off a Fairness Debate
headline.main: Solar Panel Payments Set Off a Fairness Debate
